lines.text: You guys have to promise not to tell grandma! Jay?
I promise.
Arty?
She and I have very short conversations.
I wanna join the Army.
The Army? *Our* Army?
Yeah! But they wouldn't take me. I couldn't pass the, the - hatever they give you I couldn't pass.
Do ya, do you know what color my eyes are, Johnny?
No, what?
You're lookin' right at 'em.
Oh, uh. I'm a little color blind.
You have beautiful eyes.
Naw. Men don't have beautiful eyes.
Oh, yes, they do. Don't tell me. Wanta kiss me?
Yeah. Yeah I do, I really would.
Then, kiss me.
I will.
I mean now. Today... sometime today, Okay? We've done it before, you know. You gonna put your arms around me or not?
Don't tell me how to do it, I know how to do it.
Then, do it, don't say you're gonna do it.
I said,"Okay".

[they start to kiss gently, then fall to the ground and Johnny becomes more forceful]
Okay, that's enough. Johnny, I can't breathe. Okay, Johnny, I have to breathe! Okay, that's enough for today.
[breaking off]
Woo! I don't know why they wouldn't take you in the Army!
Where would someone like Grandma hide her money?
You're not thinking of stealing it, are you?
No, but what if we just borrowed it? I'd just love to send Pop an envelope with $9,000.
Who would he think sent it to him... God?
No. He had an uncle in Poland who died. We can say he left the money to Pop in his will.
Jay, do you think the Germans would let some Jew in Poland send $9,000 to some Jew in Alabama?

[after his Aunt Bella randomly charges out of the house in tears]
See why I don't like to come here too often?

[impersonating his Aunt Gert]
Well, hello Jay. How are you? How's your father, and
[sucking in as he speaks]
*how's your little brother Arty?*
